sentences: Brian Fallon (born January 28, 1980) is an American musician, singer and songwriter.
section: N/A

sentences: He is best known as the lead vocalist, rhythm guitarist, and main lyricist of the rock band The Gaslight Anthem, with whom he has recorded five studio albums.
section: N/A

sentences: He is also a member of the duo the Horrible Crowes alongside the Gaslight Anthem's guitar technician and touring guitarist, Ian Perkins.
section: N/A

sentences: Since 2016, Fallon has released four solo albums and one EP.
section: N/A
== Biography ==

sentences: Biography ==
section: == Biography ==

sentences: Fallon was born in Red Bank, New Jersey, in 1980.
section: == Biography ==

sentences: His mother Debbie was in a folk band in the late 1960s called 'The Group Folk Singers'.
section: == Biography ==

sentences: Fallon spent his teen years in Hackettstown, New Jersey, where he became close friends with Tom "Tommy Gunn" DuHamel of the band Communication Redlight.
section: == Biography ==

sentences: Fallon attended Hackettstown High School.
section: == Biography ==

sentences: When Fallon was 17, he released a cassette under the stage name 'No Release'.
section: == Biography ==

sentences: He also once wanted to start a small record label to be called 'Old 45 Records'.
section: == Biography ==

sentences: In 2004, Fallon, along with Michael Volpe, Chris Clementi and Mike Leboeuf, founded This Charming Man.
section: == Band affiliations and projects == | === This Charming Man (2004–2005) ===

sentences: Fallon and Volpe remained the only original members when Benny Horowitz and Alex Levine joined in late 2005.
section: == Band affiliations and projects == | === This Charming Man (2004–2005) ===

sentences: In early 2006, Volpe decided to leave the band and Alex Rosamilia was brought on board, thus bringing together the future line-up of the Gaslight Anthem.
section: == Band affiliations and projects == | === This Charming Man (2004–2005) ===

sentences: This Charming Man's only full release was Every Little Secret in 2005, with the original lineup.

sentences: Molly and the Zombies is an Americana/folk group that was formed in 2013 by Fallon with guitarist and Plow United frontman Brian McGee, former Ryan Adams and the Cardinals bassist Catherine Popper, and Scissor Sisters drummer Randy Schrager.
section: == Band affiliations and projects == | === Molly and the Zombies (2013–present) ===

sentences: The band performed their first show in December 2013 in Asbury Park, New Jersey, opening for the Bouncing Souls at the Stone Pony.
section: == Band affiliations and projects == | === Molly and the Zombies (2013–present) ===

sentences: According to Fallon, there is no record deal and there will be no album.
section: == Band affiliations and projects == | === Molly and the Zombies (2013–present) ===

sentences: He also said all of the band's music, which he wrote and didn't feel like using for the Gaslight Anthem, was inspired by Bob Dylan's Highway 61 Revisited album.
section: == Band affiliations and projects == | === Molly and the Zombies (2013–present) ===

sentences: The band's name comes partially from the Roky Erickson song "I Walked With a Zombie" and a 1943 horror movie.
section: == Band affiliations and projects == | === Molly and the Zombies (2013–present) ===

sentences: Molly and the Zombies performed at The Bell House in Brooklyn, New York, on June 5, 2014, with Jared Hart of the Scandals and Dave Hause as opening acts.
section: == Band affiliations and projects == | === Molly and the Zombies (2013–present) ===

sentences: They released 5 songs for free online: "Long Drives", "Lucky", "Red Lights", "Sketchy", and "Smoke".

== Personal life ==

sentences: Personal life ==
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: Brian Fallon is a Christian, but he avoids using references to his faith in his music.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: As he stated in an interview with spinner.com referring to the Gaslight Anthem's 2010 album American Slang, "There are no religious songs and there never would be because the four of us, we all have different views, completely different religions...I'm very cautious not to push that on the band.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: "Much of the lyrics on the Gaslight Anthem's 2014 album, Get Hurt were inspired by his divorce.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: Fallon said “Sometimes, I don’t even know how it happened.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: I don’t even know how it got like this.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: All I know is that it did.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: And I now have to figure out: What do I do now?"
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: Fallon has since remarried and welcomed his second child.
